block.p: Katherine Robson Taylor and Anthony Curtis Haynes are to be married today at Trinity Episcopal Church in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Nigel Lyon Andrews is to perform the ceremony, and the Rev. Andrea Suess Taylor, the bride's sister-in-law, who is also an Episcopal priest, will take part in it.

The bride was until last week a consultant on education to the Inter-American Development Bank in Washington, an organization that provides economic development assistance to countries in the Latin American and Caribbean regions. She graduated from Hamilton College and received a master's degree in international education from Harvard University. Next month, she is to start a Ph.D. program in education policy at Vanderbilt University's Peabody College of Education and Human Development in Nashville.

Katherine Robson Taylor and Anthony Curtis Haynes are to be married today at Trinity Episcopal Church in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Nigel Lyon Andrews is to perform the ceremony, and the Rev. Andrea Suess Taylor, the bride's sister-in-law, who is also an Episcopal priest, will take part in it.

The bride was until last week a consultant on education to the Inter-American Development Bank in Washington, an organization that provides economic development assistance to countries in the Latin American and Caribbean regions. She graduated from Hamilton College and received a master's degree in international education from Harvard University. Next month, she is to start a Ph.D. program in education policy at Vanderbilt University's Peabody College of Education and Human Development in Nashville.

She is the daughter of Dorcas Billings Taylor and Paul D. Taylor of Newport. The bride's father was the ambassador to the Dominican Republic from 1988 to 1992 and now teaches international economics and conducts research in the decision support center at the Naval War College in Newport. Her mother is an adjunct professor of English at Salve Regina University, also in Newport, and is the English language instructor for officers at the Naval War College.

The bridegroom is a confidential assistant to the administrator of the Rural Utilities Service of the Agriculture Department in Washington. He graduated from the University of Tennessee at Martin and received a master's degree in public administration from the University of Memphis.

He is the son of Reba Barnes Haynes and Curtis L. Haynes of Trenton, Tenn. The bridegroom's mother, who is retired, was an accounting clerk at the Gibson Electric Membership Cooperative, a utility in Trenton. His father, who is also retired, was a technician in Trenton with the Agriculture Department's Soil Conservation Service.
